metadata.title: CVE-2016-9651 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A missing check for whether a property of a JS object is private in V8 inGoogle Chrome prior to 55.0.2883.75 allowed a remote attacker to executearbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9651` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-browser-l10n - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-chromedriver - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.19.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.19.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.19.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.19.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.19.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.2883.87-0ubuntu0.16.04.1263').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.19.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
